MITREAttackScrapper.utils package#

Submodules#

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator module#

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_campaign_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK campaign ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK campaign ID is as follows:

CXXXX
||
|+-> Campaign ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "C" meaning "Campaign"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK campaign ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If the MITRE ATT&CK campaign ID is not in the valid format.

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_group_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK group ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK group ID is as follows:

GXXXX
||
|+-> Group ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "G" meaning "Group"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK group ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If the MITRE ATT&CK group ID is not in the valid format.

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_mitigation_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK mitigation ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK mitigation ID is as follows:

MXXXX
||
|+-> Mitigation ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "M" meaning "Mitigation"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK mitigation ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If the MITRE ATT&CK mitigation ID is not in the valid format.

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_software_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK software ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK software ID is as follows:

SXXXX
||
|+-> Software ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "S" meaning "Software"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK software ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_tactic_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID is as follows:

TAXXXX
| |
| +-> Tactic ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "TA" meaning "Tactic"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If the MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID is not in the valid format.

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.mitre_id_validator.validate_mitre_technique_id(function: Callable) → Callable#

A wrapper function to validate the MITRE ATT&CK technique ID.

The format of the MITRE ATT&CK technique ID is as follows:

TXXXX[.YYY]
||     |
||     +-> Optional sub-technique ID (3 digits)
||
|+-> Technique ID (4 digits)
|
+-> Prefix "T" meaning "Technique"
Parameters:

function (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

Returns:

The wrapped function that requires the MITRE ATT&CK technique ID with valid format.

Return type:

Callable

Raises:

ValueError – If the MITRE ATT&CK technique ID is not in the valid format.

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.scrapping_helper module#

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.scrapping_helper.get_links_after_span(card_body: Tag, label: str) → List[Dict[str, str]]#

Helper function to extract the links after the span element with the given label.

For example, It can be used to extract the links after a label in the following format:

<span>Label:</span> <a href="https://example1.com">Link1</a>
<span>Label:</span> <a href="https://example2.com">Link2</a>
Parameters:

  • card_body (Tag) – The BeautifulSoup Tag object containing the card body.

  • label (str) – The label to search for.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing the name and URL of the links after the span element with the given label

Return type:

List[Dict[str, str]]

MITREAttackScrapper.utils.scrapping_helper.get_text_after_span(card_body: Tag, label: str) → str#

Helper function to extract the text after the span element with the given label.

For example, It can be used to extract the text after a label in the following format:

<span>Label:</span> Text
Parameters:

  • card_body (Tag) – The BeautifulSoup Tag object containing the card body.

  • label (str) – The label to search for.

Returns:

The text after the span element with the given label

Return type:

str
